intro: Senecio orotrephes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Senecio orotrephes is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained environments.
